722215f-a.text:
Park Avenue, south from 48th Street, the Grand Central Yards, before electrification, and the old Grand Central Station. Behind the station towers the newly built Hotel Belmont at Park Avenue and 42nd Street. To the right, is seen Tiffany House on the east side of Madison Avenue between 45th and 44th Streets, and behind it, the Hotel Manhattan, on N.W. corner of Madison Avenue and 42nd Street. The small building on N.E. corner of Madison Avenue and 45th Street is old Railroad Y.M.C.A., where Hotel Roosevelt will later stand. To extreme right are old American Express buildings, to be demolished about 1920.
1906.
New York Edison Company Collection.

722220f.text:
Park Avenue, west side, from 48th to 50th Streets, during the middle of the work of rebuilding the Grand Central Terminal and Yards. The observer is near Lexington Avenue a little south of 49th Street, which crosses the Upper Level yards at the right. The nearest of the old buildings on the north side of 49th Street is 49 East 49th Street.
The yards have been rebuilt about as far west as what will be the western side of Park Avenue when the tracks are covered over.
July, 1909.
Ewing Galloway.

722218f-a.text:
290 Park Avenue and Pierre's Restaurant, newly built, Park Avenue, west side, from 48th to 49th Streets. The fence hides the
doorway of Pierre's.
On the vacant 1ot in the right foreground, the Park Lane Hotel
will rise in 1924.
1922.
Gift of E. M. Jenks.

722217f-a.text:
290 Park Avenue, west side, between E. 48th and 49th Streets. Shown is Pierre'a Restaurant. Compare this view with that taken the
same year and showing the entire block front.
1922-1923.
Gift of E.M. Jenks.

722219f-a.text:
Park Avenue, east side, from E. 48th (right) to 49th (left) Streets, showing the newly completed Park Lane Apartment Hotel on what twenty years prior was the Adams Express Company Building site. The architects are Shulte and Weaver. Note at the left margin the Railroad Y.M.C.A. at the N.E. corner of 49th Street. Ten years later this will be razed for the block square site of the Waldorf Astoria
Hotel.
Summer 1924.
Cift of E.M. Jenks.

722221f.text:
Park Avenue, east side, between 49th and 48th Streets, showing the new Park Lane Apartment Hotel, also a glimpse of the S.E. corner of 48th Street vhere a building is under construction. In the background the Hotel Shelton, on the east side of Lexington
AVenue, 1s shown.
Autumn 1924.
Amemiys, Photographer.
MAY BE REPRODUCED, with credit.

722216f.text:
Park Avenue, east side, looking north from 48th Street, showing the new Waldorf-Astoria, on the east side between 49th and 50th
Streets, opening October first.
Below it, between 48th and 49th Streets, stands the Park Lane (1929); above, at 5lst Street, is the Ambasssdor (19204, and at
57th Street the Ritz Towers (1926).
The Queensboro Bridge is visible in right background.
September 1931.
International News Photos.
